review.description:
I cried the pizza was so good. I'm not a New Yorker so my pizza opinion isn't worth much but this was the best pizza I've ever had.

The sauce is simple, savory and sweet. The crust, well, the crust is perfect. And the cheese is the right balance or grease, melt, and thickness. 

It's a small little shop in Brooklyn. No frills, just damn good pizza.
review.author: Jarrett D.

review.description: This cute little pizza joint is a fun place for families or groups of friends! The pizza is great but the entrees are even better! They also have a big garden to sit outside, a good choice for the summer!
review.author: Carly G.

review.description: Reputation for this place is pretty strong.  Been here couple of times.  It's decent. Can be greasy. Good pizza, all styles...some way better than others. Better places to be had...go and find them!
review.author: J D.

review.description: Didn't really like my pizza from here.  I was walking by and I smelled the pizza and went, I can go for a slice.  Walked in, looked at what was available and settled on a slice.  Got it, ate it, forgot it.  Not memorable at all, which means I won't come back.  So many other options around, i'll go check them out.  Side note, the employees that were working that day were super nice.
review.author: Justin C.

review.description:
For about six months now, I've been eyeing Layla Jones but have yet to commit, until last night. Anyone in the Cobble Hill area likely knows this place smells FANTASTIC as you're passing by and it takes all your strength to keep walking past as you drag your feet to workout in the miserable 30 degree windy weather (No? Just me?).

So, yesterday I walked in before any crowds had arrived (I usually see a solid few families in here on weeknights -- it's a small place, maybe six-eight tables total) and found this place to be extremely cozy. Warm, dim lights, holiday decor, and that lovely pizza smell. I had a whole personal Sweet Lou's Lasagna pizza to myself (except that my boyfriend had to eat a solid 1/3 of it so we could finish) -- it has a meat sauce, tomato sauce, ricotta cheese and mozzarella. The crust was my favorite part. Kind of thick, a great texture, slightly crispy on the outside and perfect on the inside. I also really liked the sauce. The personal pizza is actually decently large, at four pretty big square slices.

Only a few people came in while we were there and everyone was ordering to-go (between 6-7pm), but they consistently had a LOT of orders they were leaving to deliver. Their menu states free delivery, so that's hard to beat.

Their menu also says they have a backyard area which I would have NEVER known from the front. I can't wait for warm weather so I can try it out! I only wish they had beer so I could have some pizza and beer on a warm summer day outside. Here's to hoping!

Overall, a solid pizza option in the area. Not my #1, but I'd go again to try some more options and have a cozy, not-so-packed dinner.
review.author: Kaley R.

review.description: This restaurant is so good, I've had pizza, chicken cutlet, spaghetti and meatballs and they have all been delicious. I would recommend Layla Jones for sure!
review.author: Noey V.

review.description: Best pizza in the game! In a neighborhood full of good eats, this place has carved out a special place in my heart for its Special Jane rectangle pizza. Give a try and I dare you to disagree. Big ups, Miss Layla Jones!
review.author: Faisal S.

review.description: Layla Jones is my go-to pizza place. They have really really good pizza - I like to order the Farmers pizza with the sweet sausage or the Sweet Jane with onions and sweet sausage. Sweet Jane is probably my favorite.  Taking one star off only because every once in a while you'll get a cold bland pizza but almost all of the time it's great. I might order one tonight.
review.author: Rmr N.

review.description:
Came into Layla Jones one Sunday evening for dinner and wow, great food and great pizza. We ordered a margherita pie to share and I had myself one of their CalJones! The pizza was top notch. Fresh ingredients, good sauce, fresh basil, good crust and good cheese. They got this one down right and better than the touristy pizza joints nearby. The CalJones is a calzone obviously but the way they do it was a bit different. It more shaped like a chicken roll but larger. They cover the outer top with cheese and bake it. The whole thing is very crunchy and crispy. It's a nice variation of a calzone. It almost reminds me of a chicken bake from Costco but just a million times better.

Service was also great. The waiter was very friendly. We sat outside in the back. It's a nice cozy little shindig. Tons of mosquitoes though. My legs and arse was chewed up by the time we left for Chip Shop. I would highly recommend Layla Jones and on Sunday, it was nice and quiet. No problems finding parking whatsoever.
review.author: Gary L.

review.description:
Review for Delivery - Whenever I'm craving pizza (usually late at night after long study sessions) my first choice is Layla Jones. My go-to is the Sweet Jane pizza which has pesto, mozzarella and romano. I then add on pepperoni. I have never had a late delivery and my pizza is always still warm when it comes to me. I love the flavor of the sauce! For the large pizza (because I like leftovers) and a drink, it does seem to add up. With 20% tip my most recent order ended up being a little over $30, but there are 8 big slices of pizza which will give me a lot of tasty leftovers. 

I have never been inside the restaurant so I can not review how the wait service is or how the Restruant looks, but delivery wise it has been flawless.
review.author: Chelsea D.

review.description:
After one hour we checked the phone and saw someone texted (TEXTED?) "delivery" 2 minutes prior. We called back twice and it seemed he didn't want to come to the door but finally he came in as we held the buzzer for 30 seconds. The pizza looks and tastes like when you go to a slice place and the pie has been hanging out at room temp for an hour or more with pretty dry cheese. 

Bummed to leave this review because we order all the time but it's been too many times over the past year that the overall service and food has gone down hill.
review.author: Robyn H.

review.description: Solid pizza,  quick delivery, nice people.
review.author: James Z.

review.description:
Delicious unique and affordable. Very good especially for only $5 for two slices and a drink at lunch. Crust is light and airy while still having great flavor. Can't wait to come back.

The interior and branding feel at odds with the quality of the product. A facelift inside and a new logo might help underscore that this isn't just another mediocre NY pizza place.
review.author: Ryan C.

review.description:
If you want a super crispy square slice that comes out piping hot, and is absolutely delicious, and that you can eat while the intro guitar riff of "Layla" is stuck in your head, then you need to come here. I got a regular and a pepperoni slice and they were just perfect. The crust was just the right thickness. The pepperoni was just the right amount of oily.

Not the biggest restaurant, but we were in and out pretty quickly for takeout.
review.author: Kenny C.

review.description: Layla Jones is definitely one of Brooklyn's hidden gems. Everything about their pizza is awesome from the soft, but crispy crust to their delicious sauce. They don't overdo it with the cheese either and there's little to no grease. It's certainly not one of those slices you'll have to use a tissue to pat down. Another bonus is their lunch special; you can get two plain slices and a soda or water for just $5. Finding affordable food, especially in Brooklyn Heights/Downtown Brooklyn can be a tough task sometimes, so this deal is much appreciated. You'll probably never read about Layla Jones on Eater or some other website like that, but trust me this place  serves some of Brooklyn's best pizza. Just walk by and smell what their cooking up, you'll be drawn in just like I was!
review.author: Devin B.

review.description: Pizza delivered quickly and still crisp when it arrives? What is this, heaven? I ordered the Margherita pizza, half with pepperoni and the other half with homemade sausage, both equally divine. I think I have definitely found my new go-to pizza delivery option and will have to make a trip to the store one day soon!
review.author: Shu Jin S.

review.description: I walk by lovely Layla Jones so many times since moving to NYC, and I finally experienced her splendor. I think the concept of a square slice makes me feel like I'm about to eat a child's bland boring pizza, and therefore always kept me away. Thanks to a fellow yelper Kenny, he said I gotta try a slice! And boy am I glad I did. They do a deal for a plain cheese slice and a soda for a couple bucks. I'm not a plain cheese guy though, how will I be able to enjoy a near naked SQUARE slice?! All my red flags were signaled, until that first super crispy corner bite. DAMN. If eating a square slice makes me a child, call me Baby Boy Blue. esh. Ok, I'm in love with this slice. I legit crave a slice now EVERY TIME I WALK BY! Seriously, every damn time. I'm going to get one on my way home now. And that's the gist.
review.author: Mike S.

review.description: Delisous pizza and great ambiance. The staff was super accommodating. At first this looks like a typical pizza  takeout shop - meaning, tables, chairs,  oven, cashier. No ambiance-- ask to go to the patio and it's the cutest backyard,they come to bring your order with no problem. I was pregnant at the time of coming here needlesz to say it was the most delicious pizza ever.
review.author: Sindy S.

review.description: This is my favorite place to order pizza from. It's a little oily however super delicious & really fast delivery.
review.author: Christina G.

review.description:
Layla Jones offers a pie called the Sweet Jane, it's essentially a Margherita with pesto on top and it's the closest thing to a come-to-jesus moment I have experienced in a pizzeria setting since a visit to Lou Malnati's in Chicago last year. 

We hosted a pizza party for a coworker at our office nearby and ordered pizza from five or six pizza joints in our delivery zone. The pies that came from Layla Jones were definitely the crowd favorite. It's all about that perfectly crispy crust. The only downside is they do not offer the Sweet Jones as slices -- Would be a really nice treat to stop in for lunch. 

PRO-TIP: If you are planning a visit, come on a nice day! Layla Jones boasts a lovely backyard.
review.author: Siobhán H.
